TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void AccessKeyPressedEventHandler(object sender, AccessKeyPressedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed AccessKeyPressedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub AccessKeyPressedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As AccessKeyPressedEventArgs)
public delegate void AccessKeyPressedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, AccessKeyPressedEventArgs ^ e);
type AccessKeyPressedEventHandler = delegate of obj * AccessKeyPressedEventArgs -> unit

param.name: sender
param.span: Objeto en que está asociado el controlador de eventos.

span.span: The object where the event handler is attached.

summary.span: Representa el método que va a controlar el evento adjunto .

span.span: Represents the method that will handle the attached event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Obtener acceso a las claves de [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] se controlan mediante una clase de administrador que actúa como un servicio para las claves de acceso y reenvía la entrada de teclas de acceso a la [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] sistema de entrada.Access keys in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] are handled by a manager class that acts somewhat like a service for access keys, and forwards access key input to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] input system. En lugar de controlar la tecla de acceso que se presionó eventos específicamente adjuntando un controlador para el evento adjunto en un objeto específico, por lo general es una mejor práctica para asociar la clave de acceso a un comando determinado mediante un enlace de comando y, a continuación, controlar los comandos enrutados a través de los eventos enrutados correspondientes.Rather than handling access key pressed events specifically by attaching a handler for the attached event on a specific object, it is generally a better practice to associate the access key with a particular command through a command binding, and then handle the routed commands through the corresponding routed events. Esta técnica proporciona un sistema unificado de eventos de entrada del usuario, independientemente de qué modo de entrada inicia la entrada.This technique provides a unified event system for user input regardless of what input mode initiated the input. Para obtener más información, consulte [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).For more information, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md).
